DOC.brief_summary: E-cigarettes deliver nicotine create aerosol ultrafine particle . Many question remain size composition especially potential toxicity particle . Thus , key unanswered question—and research question proposed—is whether e-cigarette aerosol trigger acute impairment coronary microvessel function conventional cigarette smoke , delivers well-defined exposure fine particle many fold great exposure toxic ( combustion ) product include volatile organic compound ( acrolein ) implicate pathogenesis tobacco-related coronary disease . Because effect nicotine human coronary microcirculation remain incompletely defined—with multiple potential vasodilator vasoconstrictor action may vary dose—we determine comparative effect conventional cigarette smoke e-cigarette aerosol nicotine , low-dose nicotine , high-dose nicotine .
DOC.brief_title: E-Cigarette Aerosol , Conventional Cigarette Smoke , Myocardial Perfusion
DOC.criteria: Age 1849 Regular cigarette smoker define least 1 pack year ≥ 5/day Ecigarette smoker define ≥ 1/week last 6 month . Suboptimal echocardiography image determine sonographer and/or investigator . History cardiopulmonary ( include asthma use inhaler ) , History diabetes dyslipidemia History psychiatric illness Blood Pressure > 140/90 Body Mass Index ≤ 18.5 ≥ 30 kg•m2 Evidence physical examination , Electrocardiogram ( ECG ) echocardiogram Resting Heart Rate > 100 beats/min Cardiac rhythm disorder , specifically : rhythm sinus , Supraventricular Tachycardia ( SVT ) , atrial fibrillation , ventricular tachycardia Use prescription medication except oral contraceptive pill History illicit drug use ( selfstated ) Pregnant Any condition ( ) deem physician investigator put subject risk participate study
